addValidator((bytes,bytes,bytes32)).details: You should verify offchain that the validator is indeed valid before adding it Reason we don't do that here is for gas

addValidators((bytes,bytes,bytes32)[]).details: You should verify offchain that the validators are indeed valid before adding them Reason we don't do that here is for gas

clearValidatorArray().details: Need to do this before setWithdrawalCredential()

setWithdrawalCredential(bytes).details: May need to call clearValidatorArray() first

getValidator(uint256).notice: Return the information of the i'th validator in the registry

getValidatorStruct(bytes,bytes,bytes32).notice: Returns a Validator struct of the given inputs to make formatting addValidator inputs easier

popValidators(uint256).notice: Remove validators from the end of the validators array, in case they were added in error

removeValidator(uint256,bool).notice: Remove a validator from the array. If dont_care_about_ordering is true,   a swap and pop will occur instead of a more gassy loop

setWithdrawalCredential(bytes).notice: Requires empty validator stack as changing withdrawal creds invalidates signature

swapValidator(uint256,uint256).notice: Swap the location of one validator with another
